message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of sparse subgraphs of a graph that preserve shortest path distances up to a multiplicative factor, which is a fundamental problem in graph theory and algorithms. The focus is on fault-tolerant spanners, which are relevant in distributed and robust network design. The paper uses techniques from data structures, geometry, and combinatorics, and provides lower and upper bounds on the size of spanners in different fault models. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DS (data structures and algorithms), cs.CG (computational geometry), and cs.DM (discrete mathematics). The paper also involves numerical analysis (cs.NA) and simulation (cs.SI) to evaluate the performance of the proposed algorithms.
